cold_snaps.status: No cold snap is happening right now.  There have been 6 such events this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference so far is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwave.status: No active heatwave is observed currently.  The count for this year stands at 6, while the average is around 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: 13.04mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional precipitation event and ranked 8th out of our records.  A rate of 8.6mm per hour was recorded during the 7.9 hour long storm.  On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 27.64mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 15.9 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: Today ranked top for the heaviest rain with a peak rain rate of 27.0mm per hour, lasting 2.0 hours and total rainfall of 7.99mm.

storm.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024, characterized by a peak rain intensity of 6.4mm per hour and a total rainfall of 24.56mm.
We are currently experiencing a storm.  This is the first such event since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the ranked 5th longest since our records started in August 2024.  There have been 9 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (206°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 77.76 miles.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.2 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1602 m) and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 12.6m lower than yesterday, 499.9m lower than the past week, 1602.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 713m and a peak of 1594m, averaging 1054.3m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; the temperature will feel nicely warm and pleasant. Also, you’ll experience intense stickiness in the air and winds will be practically absent. Some rain can be expected, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and bright intervals likely. Changeable conditions.
